section.p: Attention: Parents, Guardians, Students and Staff.Â Due to the Coronavirus Pandemic, Governor Wolf has closed schools in Pennsylvania for students until the end of our academic year.Â We will follow our original school calendar.Â Thank you.

During the School Closure, please use the following methods to communicate with us if you have any questions or concerns.Â Please call (724) 981-8750 and when the message begins to play dial the extension listed.
Attn: Parents, Guardians, Students and Staff.Â As required by PDE we have developed a Continuity of Education Plan that will guide us during the school closure.Â Thank you.

section.div: Due to these very difficult and uncertain times, the school counselor at Ionta Elementary and Delahunty Middle School wanted to assist you and your family by building a resource center that can be accessed from the comfort of your home. Throughout this website we have provided videos on how to speak to your family about the Coronovirus, educational activites and games for your children, as well as fun activities that can be played at home. This resource center will provide you with tons of connections and we hope it helps you get through the remainder of the school year!

section.p: Spectrum is offering their Internet service for 60 days at no cost to any family with a student in grades k-12 or college.Â The phone number to subscribe to this service is 1.844.488.8395.Â Please be prepared for longer than normal wait times.Â Thank you.

header.h2: Important Information About Accessing Student Resources

section.div: Please find information on how to access Google Classroom for grades k-3 & 4-12. Additionally, please find the link to the Hermitage School District Instructional technology site, which provides information about the programs your student may be using.Â

section.p: Do you need transportation for essential needs?Â Connecting Mercer County may be able to provide you with free transportation throughout Mercer County!*
*Essential needs include grocery shopping, prescription pickup, etc.
Limited time only, restrictions may apply

In February of 2017 your student participated in the pilot phase of our 1:1 Chromebook program.Â At the time, we were not sure what we would expect in terms of damage, so the school district purchased 3 years of Accidental Damage Insurance and Extended Warranty Coverage for those Chromebooks.Â That coverage expired on February 17th after which any parts needed to make repairs will be at the expense of the parent.Â We do have some used parts to reduce the cost of those repairs, but those supplies are limited.Â Current prices for new parts are available on theÂ District's website.Â We have partnered with Worth Ave. Insurance Group to offer an insurance policy to cover those devices until June 2021.Â The cost of that coverage is $36.50.Â Â If you would like to purchase this additional coverage, please submit payment in the form of either a check or money order made payable to the Hermitage School District to Ms. Mlakar in the HHS Library.Â Please note that coverage can be added until the end of the school year at that price, but coverage will still expire June 30th, 2021.Â
section.div:
Insurance Coverage (Unlimited Incidents):
Accidental Damage
includes drops/cracked screens/liquid spillsÂ
Fire/Flood Damage
Vandalism
Liquid SubmersionÂ
Natural Disasters
Power Surge Due To Lightning
Â Extended Warranty Coverage:

ul.li: Manufacture Defect
Mechanical Failure

div.div: If you have any questions, please contact Ms. Mlakar at 724.981.8750 ext 1300.

section.p:
Attention HHS Students: Week in WELDING at LTI. Â
Please read this flyer about the requirements to participate in the WEEK in WELDING at LTI this summer for any junior or senior.
Please sign up in the guidance office as soon as possible.

p.span: The Hermitage School District has an online registration process for all incoming students for 2020-21. Please go to our the Student Registration Page

to access the online forms, fill in the required information and upload the necessary documents to complete your childâ€™s registration.Â This link will not work for students wanting to enroll for 2019-20.Â If you need to register a student for the current school year, please call (724)981-8750 ext. 6000.

If you do not have access to a computer, Chromebooks will be available at our Central Administration Office (411 N. Hermitage Rd.) for your use once we are permitted to re-open. We will post the re-open date in the Sharon Herald and on the Hermitage School District website once it has been confirmed.

span.strong: Please note that this is only for new students or students who were not enrolled at the end of the 2019-20 school year.Â The Returning Student Information Form will be available in the summer of 2020 for all currently enrolled students so that parents can update their student's demographic and medical information.

section.p: Attention Parents, Students and Staff:Â At the School Board Meeting held on January 21st, 2020, theÂ 2020-21 School CalendarÂ was approved. Â Thank you.

div.p: "The Mission of the Hermitage School District is to educate our students toÂ become motivated and responsible citizens.Â We will graduate students who are critical thinkers, effective problem solvers, strong communicators and creative individuals.Â Our students will use literacy, writing and technology as tools to contribute and compete in a diverse society."

span.a: Act 80 Day - No School for Students
